headline: Why Tesla (TSLA) Stock Is Trading Up Today
summary: Shares of electric vehicle pioneer Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) jumped 3.4% in the afternoon session after Melius Research initiated coverage on the stock with a "Buy" rating and a price target of $520. headline: Factbox-From OpenAI to Meta, firms channel billions into AI infrastructure as demand booms
summary: The companies said OpenAI would design the chips, which Broadcom will develop and deploy starting in the second half of 2026.  AMD agreed to supply artificial intelligence chips to OpenAI in a multi-year deal that would also give the ChatGPT creator the option to buy up to roughly 10% of the chipmaker.  Nvidia is set to invest up to $100 billion in OpenAI and supply it with data center chips, in a deal giving the chipmaker a financial stake in OpenAI.

headline: Oracle Event Is Chance to Show $370 Billion Stock Rally Has Legs
summary: The software maker is hosting a four-day AI World conference starting Monday in Las Vegas, where much of the focus will be on Oracle’s cloud computing business, whose rapid expansion has fueled a 76% run-up in the stock that has made it one of 2025’s best performers in the S&P 500.  The event comes just as concerns are building that Oracle is sacrificing profitability for growth from renting computing power to AI companies like OpenAI.  Last week, the Information reported Oracle’s cloud margins are lower than many on Wall Street are modeling, sending Oracle shares down as much as 7.1% on Tuesday.

raw.headline: Oracle Event Is Chance to Show $370 Billion Stock Rally Has Legs
raw.summary: The software maker is hosting a four-day AI World conference starting Monday in Las Vegas, where much of the focus will be on Oracle’s cloud computing business, whose rapid expansion has fueled a 76% run-up in the stock that has made it one of 2025’s best performers in the S&P 500.  The event comes just as concerns are building that Oracle is sacrificing profitability for growth from renting computing power to AI companies like OpenAI.  Last week, the Information reported Oracle’s cloud margins are lower than many on Wall Street are modeling, sending Oracle shares down as much as 7.1% on Tuesday.

headline: AI demand for chips drives Samsung's expected Q3 profit surge
summary: STORY: Samsung is expected to post its highest third-quarter profit since 2022.Analysts polled by LSEG say the surge is driven by higher memory chip prices, backed by AI-driven server demand.They project the South Korean tech giant will rake in over $7 billion for the July to September period, up 10% from a year earlier.This comes ahead of Samsung's official estimates out Tuesday, with full results due later this month.The expected recovery offsets weaker sales volumes for high-bandwidth memory, or HBM chips.Samsung's profits and share price had taken a hit, in part due to delays supplying the latest models of those chips to Nvidia.But industry experts say market sentiment toward the firm is improving after deals with OpenAI and Tesla.Since the EV pioneer agreed to source semiconductors from Samsung, in a $16.5 billion deal signed in July, the chipmaker's shares have risen more than 43%.While local rival SK Hynix has gained more from the AI-driven demand, Samsung has been held back by its exposure to China, where advanced chip sales are restricted by the U.S.Gauging the firm's prospects, experts say they're also wary of the effects of U.S. tariffs on semiconductors, and China's tightening controls on the rare earth minerals used in tech products.

raw.headline: AI demand for chips drives Samsung's expected Q3 profit surge
raw.summary: STORY: Samsung is expected to post its highest third-quarter profit since 2022.Analysts polled by LSEG say the surge is driven by higher memory chip prices, backed by AI-driven server demand.They project the South Korean tech giant will rake in over $7 billion for the July to September period, up 10% from a year earlier.This comes ahead of Samsung's official estimates out Tuesday, with full results due later this month.The expected recovery offsets weaker sales volumes for high-bandwidth memory, or HBM chips.Samsung's profits and share price had taken a hit, in part due to delays supplying the latest models of those chips to Nvidia.But industry experts say market sentiment toward the firm is improving after deals with OpenAI and Tesla.Since the EV pioneer agreed to source semiconductors from Samsung, in a $16.5 billion deal signed in July, the chipmaker's shares have risen more than 43%.While local rival SK Hynix has gained more from the AI-driven demand, Samsung has been held back by its exposure to China, where advanced chip sales are restricted by the U.S.Gauging the firm's prospects, experts say they're also wary of the effects of U.S. tariffs on semiconductors, and China's tightening controls on the rare earth minerals used in tech products.

headline: Central banks stoked the dotcom bubble. They’re doing it again for AI
summary: Blow-out quarterly earnings estimates from American software and cloud services specialist Oracle, a $100bn (£75bn) investment in ChatGPT developer OpenAI by silicon chip designer Nvidia and, in reverse, the purchase of a 10pc stake by OpenAI in another semiconductor maker, AMD, are all keeping the artificial intelligence (AI) pot boiling, so far as stock markets are concerned.

headline: 3 Reasons TSLA is Risky and 1 Stock to Buy Instead
summary: What a time it’s been for Tesla. In the past six months alone, the company’s stock price has increased by a massive 61.7%, reaching $408.09 per share. This run-up might have investors contemplating their next move.

headline: Dow Jones Futures Rise As Trump Says 'Eternity' Before Extra 100% China Tariff
summary: The stock market dived with President Trump imposing huge China tariffs late Friday. He said Sunday that "all will be fine." Oracle AI World looms.
